steps.title: Launch & land on dashboard
details: Minor UI warnings surfaced (inconsistent typography, padding).

steps.title: Open “Add Task” modal
details: User clicks the + / Add-Task button; modal appears in 5 of 6 runs.
UI checker again flags spacing / style inconsistencies.

steps.title: Fill in task details
details: Task Name, Description and Category are entered without functional errors in most runs.
One run (TEST-zlekvij) cannot locate the Task Name field – modal rendering issue or selector mismatch.

steps.title: Pick a deadline
details: TEST-8x4rv1e loops 15× trying to open the date-picker → step aborted (possible invisible overlay or disabled field).

steps.title: Click “Create Task”
details: Major blocker in two flows (TEST-gp6fsae, TEST-u4j7hud).
Click is intercepted by the still-open Categories dropdown; pointer events blocked → 5 s timeout.
Down-stream steps (success message, list update, drag-and-drop, pinning, etc.) remain pending.

steps.title: Extended task operations (drag, pin, mark done, etc.)
details: All downstream interactions are skipped because task creation never completes.

steps.title: Control run that passes
details: One long exploratory run (TEST-y04binn) eventually submits the form and passes, confirming the core path can work, but UI audits still highlight the same visual issues.

emotional_arc: The session starts with mild optimism— the dashboard loads quickly and the Add-Task modal appears. Confidence fades into irritation as visual inconsistencies pile up. Frustration spikes when Create-Task and Date-picker actions fail repeatedly (they look clickable but do nothing). Momentum is lost; user feels stuck, uncertain whether data is saved. In the one successful flow, relief arrives, but lingering UI rough edges prevent delight.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users cannot finish a task when hidden overlays (category menu) sit above primary CTAs — leading to dead-end frustration.
next_actions: Auto-close dropdown/onBlur when an option is chosen.
Raise z-index of modal footer OR lower z-index of popover so it never covers the footer area.
Add E2E test that asserts Create-Task button is clickable after category selection.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Endless retry loop signals the date field is either off-screen, disabled, or lacks focus management, blocking progress.
next_actions: Ensure the input receives focus and opens the picker on click and keyboard.
Add visible affordance (calendar icon) with aria-label.
Write unit test for opening/closing date-picker.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Failure to locate “Task Name” suggests dynamic IDs or conditional rendering that QA & assistive tech can’t find.
next_actions: Use stable data-testids / aria-labels on all fields.
Render modal fields immediately (then disable if needed) to keep selectors constant.
Add empty-state placeholder text so humans can spot fields quickly.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Repeated “looks off” flags erode brand trust and make the layout feel unfinished.
next_actions: Adopt a global typographic scale (e.g., 16/20/24 px).
Define spacing tokens (8-pt grid) and use in MUI theme.
Audit button variants; reduce to primary / secondary with fixed sizes.
Run automated visual regression after theme changes.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Low contrast harms accessibility and may breach WCAG AA; brand colors feel inconsistent.
next_actions: Re-evaluate palette in Figma; pair each brand color with an accessible contrast fallback.
Expose category colors in a fixed grid rather than free-form to control contrast.
Add storybook a11y addon to flag contrast issues early.

first_tackles.description: Close or lower z-index of Category dropdown automatically so “Create Task” is never obstructed.
Stabilize Date-picker click/focus behaviour and add a visible calendar icon.
Add consistent data-testids & aria-labels to all modal fields to prevent selector failures.
Apply a base type scale and 8-pt spacing tokens in the global MUI theme for instant visual polish.
Introduce automated a11y/contrast checks in CI to catch color issues early.
